Title: Prove that the multiplicative inverse of $a$ modulo $m$ exists if and only if $a$ and $m$ are coprime.
Content: Prove that the multiplicative inverse of $a$ modulo $m$ exists if and only if $a$ and $m$ are coprime. Can someone help me with this?
AcceptedAnswer: Hint: $a,m$ coprime implies the existence of integers $r,s$ s.t. $ra+sm=1$ (lemma of Bezout). Hint2: If $ra=1$ mod $m$ then $m|ra-1$ so that $ra-1=sm$ for some integer $m$
